author: Staff Reporter
text:
Tensed moments prevailed at the R.S. Puram Police Station on Monday, as one of the two parties involved in a dispute alleged that the counsel of the opposite side allegedly attacked them. Meanwhile, a group of lawyers thronged the police station in support of the lawyer, alleging that the lawyer was attacked by the members of the opposite party.

Case registered

The Race Course police have registered a case against Gayathri and Susheela, who work as maids in a house on Puliyakulam Road, over suspicion that they could have stolen 14 g of gold from a broken gold chain that was kept on the table of their employer, on Saturday.

On a complaint lodged by the employer, Rajiv Sinha, they were booked under Section 381 (theft by clerk or servant of property in possession of master) of the Indian Penal Code.

Further inquiries are under way.
title: Tension at police station
